sen.j: 大内 義弘（おおうち よしひろ、延文元年/正平 (日本)11年（1356年） - 応永6年12月21日 (旧暦)（1400年1月17日））は室町時代の守護大名である。
sen.e: Yoshihiro OUCHI (1356-January 17, 1400) was the shugo daimyo (shugo, which were Japanese provincial military governors, that became daimyo, which were Japanese feudal lords) in Muromachi period.
Yoshihiro OUCHI (1356-January 25, 1400) was the shugo daimyo (shugo, which were Japanese provincial military governors, that became daimyo, which were Japanese feudal lords) in the Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: ユリウス→グレゴリオ暦に修正、in the Muromachi periodとしました。
sen.e: Yoshihiro OUCHI (1356-January 25, 1400) was the shugo daimyo (shugo, which were Japanese provincial military governors, that became daimyo, which were Japanese feudal lords) in the Muromachi period.

sen.j: 大内弘世の子。
sen.e: He was the son of Hiroyo OUCHI.
He was the son of Hiroyo OUCHI.
He was the son of Hiroyo OUCHI.

sen.j: 子に大内持世、大内持盛、娘（大友親世室）。
sen.e: He had the sons, Mochiyo OUCHI and Mochimori OUCHI and a daughter (who was the wife of Chikayo OUCHI).
He had the sons, Mochiyo OUCHI and Mochimori OUCHI and a daughter (who was the wife of Chikayo OTOMO).
sen.cmt: Chikayo OUCHI→Chikayo OTOMOに修正しました。
sen.e: He had the sons, Mochiyo OUCHI and Mochimori OUCHI and a daughter (who was the wife of Chikayo OTOMO).

sen.j: 兄弟に大内満弘、大内盛見、大内弘茂。
sen.e: Mitsuhiro OUCHI, Morimi OUCHI, and Hiroshige OUCHI were his brothers.
Mitsuhiro OUCHI, Morimi OUCHI, and Hiroshige OUCHI were his brothers.
Mitsuhiro OUCHI, Morimi OUCHI, and Hiroshige OUCHI were his brothers.

sen.j: 父弘世の代に南朝 (日本)方から室町幕府に帰順した周防国（山口県）における有力な守護大名で、九州探題を務めていた今川貞世に協力して、九州における南朝の勢力を追討した。
sen.e: His father, Hiroyo, assisted Sadayo IMAGAWA who was the powerful shugo daimyo in Suo Province (Yamaguchi Prefecture) and served as Kyushu Tandai (local commissioner) after returning to allegiance to the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) from the Southern Court (Japan), in order to defeat the forces of the Southern Court in Kyushu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: His father, Hiroyo, assisted Sadayo IMAGAWA who was the powerful shugo daimyo in Suo Province (Yamaguchi Prefecture) and served as Kyushu Tandai (local commissioner) after returning to allegiance to the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) from the Southern Court (Japan), in order to defeat the forces of the Southern Court in Kyushu.

His father, Hiroyo, assisted Sadayo IMAGAWA who was the powerful shugo daimyo in Suo Province (Yamaguchi Prefecture) and served as Kyushu Tandai (local commissioner) after returning to allegiance to the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) from the Southern Court (Japan), in order to defeat the forces of the Southern Court in Kyushu.

sen.j: その追討に功績を挙げ、豊前国の守護職を与えられた。
sen.e: Due to the great achievement in defeating the opponent, Hiroyo was granted shugoshiki (post of provincial constable) in Buzen Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Due to the great achievement in defeating the opponent, Hiroyo was granted shugoshiki (post of provincial constable) in Buzen Province.
Due to the great achievement in defeating the opponent, Hiroyo was granted shugoshiki (post of provincial constable) in Buzen Province.

sen.j: 弘世が亡くなると、周防から石見国、長門国の守護職も兼任した。
sen.e: After Hiroyo died, Yoshihiro served as shugoshiki in Iwami Province and Nagato Province as well as in Suo Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After Hiroyo died, Yoshihiro served as shugoshiki in Iwami Province and Nagato Province as well as in Suo Province.
After Hiroyo died, Yoshihiro served as shugoshiki in Iwami Province and Nagato Province as well as in Suo Province.

sen.j: また、1391年に山名氏の内紛からはじまる明徳の乱の鎮圧や1392年には南朝との仲介を行い南北朝合一にも尽力した。
sen.e: He contributed to suppressing Meitoku Rebellion that occurred in the wake of the internal conflict of the Yamana clan in 1391, and made efforts for the unification of Southern and Northern Courts by meditating between the Muromachi bakufu and the Southern Court in 1392.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処”南朝と室町幕府との間の仲介”と訳しました。
sen.e: He contributed to suppressing the Meitoku War that occurred in the wake of the internal conflict of the Yamana clan in 1391, and made efforts for the unification of Southern and Northern Courts by meditating between the Muromachi bakufu and the Southern Court in 1392.
sen.cmt: 統一事項に基づき、Meitoku Rebellion→the Meitoku Warとしました。
sen.e: He contributed to suppressing the Meitoku War that occurred in the wake of the internal conflict of the Yamana clan in 1391, and made efforts for the unification of Southern and Northern Courts by meditating between the Muromachi bakufu and the Southern Court in 1392.

sen.j: これら一連の功績から、和泉国と紀伊国の守護職も与えられた。
sen.e: Such a series of his achievements additionally granted him shugoshiki in Izumi Province and Kii Province.

sen.j: また、中国の明王朝とも独自の貿易を行ない、瀬戸内海では細川氏と対立し、北九州から中国地方、さらに中央と勢力を大きく拡大していた。
sen.e: In addition, he independently traded with Ming Dynasty in China and expanded his influence to Kitakyushu and Chugoku regions and even to the central part of Japan after fighting with the Hosokawa clan in Seto Inland Sea.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In addition, he independently traded with the Ming Dynasty in China and expanded his influence to Kitakyushu (northern Kyushu) and Chugoku regions and even to the central part of Japan after fighting with the Hosokawa clan in Seto Inland Sea.
sen.cmt: the Ming Dynastyとし、Kitakyushu→Kitakyushu (northern Kyushu)としました。
sen.e: In addition, he independently traded with the Ming Dynasty in China and expanded his influence to Kitakyushu (northern Kyushu) and Chugoku regions and even to the central part of Japan after fighting with the Hosokawa clan in Seto Inland Sea.

sen.j: 有力守護大名の弱体化を図る足利義満は義弘を圧迫し、1399年上洛命令をするなど挑発をすると義弘は上洛を拒否し、鎌倉公方の足利満兼と通じて蜂起して反乱を起こす（応永の乱）。
sen.e: Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, who sought to weaken dominant shugo daimyo, put pressure on Yoshihiro and provoked him to go to the capital in 1399, but Yoshihiro refused Yoshimitsu's order and rose in revolt (the Oei Rebellion) together with Mitsukane ASHIKAGA who was Kamakura kubo (Governor-general of the Kanto region).

Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, who sought to weaken dominant shugo daimyo, put pressure on Yoshihiro and provoked him to go to the capital in 1399, but Yoshihiro refused Yoshimitsu's order and rose in revolt (the Oei War) together with Mitsukane ASHIKAGA who was Kamakura kubo (Governor-general of the Kanto region).
sen.cmt: 全角アポストロフィーを半角に修正、the Oei Rebellion→the Oei Warに修正しました。

sen.j: 義満は禅僧の絶海中津を派遣して降伏を勧めるが義弘は5000の軍勢を率いて和泉の堺市に籠城して満兼の援軍を待った。
sen.e: Although Yoshimitsu dispatched Chushin ZEKKAI, a Zen monk, to Yoshihiro to surrender, Yoshihiro held up in a castle in Sakai City, in Izumi Province with his 5000 soldiers and waited for the reinforcements of Mitsukane.

Although Yoshimitsu dispatched Zekkai Chushin, a Zen monk, to Yoshihiro to surrender, Yoshihiro held up in a castle in Sakai City, in Izumi Province with his 5000 soldiers and waited for the reinforcements of Mitsukane.
sen.cmt: 僧侶名のため、Chushin ZEKKAI→Zekkai Chushinの順としました。

sen.j: 義満が奉公衆を率いて火攻めをなどを行い義弘は畠山満家に討ち取られる。
sen.e: Yoshimitsu, with Hokoshu (the shogunal military guard), attacked by setting fire, and Yoshihiro was killed by Mitsuie HATAKEYAMA.
